item.title: 丰田汽车集团旗下公司将对丰田工业的收购报价提高15%
item.description: 丰田汽车集团旗下企业电装公司周三宣布，将把对集团企业丰田工业的要约收购价格提高至每股18,800日元（约合118.11美元），作为将这家叉车制造商私有化计划的一部分。【原文：Toyota Motor group company Denso will raise its tender offer price for group firm Toyota Industries to 18,800 yen ($118.11) per share as part of its plan to take the forklift maker private, it said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 日本央行将自保置于与美联储鲍威尔团结之上
item.description: 日本央行缺席了各国央行支持美联储主席杰罗姆·鲍威尔的行列，这既反映出其对政治的回避，也体现了日本政府在临近提前大选之际不愿得罪美国的态度。【原文：The Bank of Japan's absence from a list of central banks lining up to support Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell reflects its aversion to politics and the government's reluctance to cross the U.S., with an early election on the horizon.】

item.title: 奥迪2025年交付量下滑
item.description: 大众汽车旗下高端品牌奥迪周三表示，受关税政策和竞争激烈的市场环境影响，2025年其汽车交付量同比下降2.9%。【原文：Volkswagen's premium brand Audi saw a 2.9% decline in vehicle deliveries in 2025, impacted by tariffs and the competitive market environment, the company said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 研究表明：150年后，蒸汽机仍是德国薪资与创新差距的根源
item.description: 蒸汽机问世已久，至今仍在塑造德国经济格局。最新研究表明，早期采用该技术的地区仍保持着竞争优势，这暗示着人工智能的早期应用或将带来类似效益。【原文：The steam engine is still shaping Germany's economy long after its invention with a new study saying areas that adopted the technology early still carry advantages, suggesting that early adoption of AI could bring similar benefits.】

item.title: 中国汽车销量与出口量预计将在2026年趋缓
item.description: 中国汽车行业协会周三表示，受需求疲软和外部不确定性持续影响，中国汽车销量和出口增速将放缓。【原文：China's vehicle sales and exports are headed for a slowdown amid sluggish demand and lingering external uncertainties, a major Chinese industry association said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 据报道，亚马逊将对意大利的罚款提出上诉，即使罚款金额已下调。
item.description: 据意大利《金融报》周三报道，美国电商巨头亚马逊将对意大利法院的裁决提出上诉。该法院此前将该国反垄断监管机构开出的罚款金额予以减免，而亚马逊认为自己根本不应被处以罚款。【原文：U.S. e-commerce giant Amazon will appeal against a decision by an Italian court that reduced a fine imposed by the country's antitrust regulator as it believes it should not be charged at all, Italian daily MF reported on Wednesday.】

item.title: 马斯克称特斯拉自2月14日起将仅提供月付制自动驾驶软件
item.description: 特斯拉首席执行官埃隆·马斯克周三表示，这家电动汽车制造商的完全自动驾驶（FSD）软件将于2月14日之后仅以月度订阅形式提供。【原文：Tesla CEO Elon Musk said on Wednesday that the electric vehicle maker's full self-driving (FSD) software will only be available as a monthly subscription after February 14.】

item.title: 独家：印尼网约车行业或因总统令草案面临重大调整
item.description: 据两名消息人士透露，印度尼西亚总统普拉博沃·苏比安托正在审议的一项法令草案将大幅提高该国数百万网约车司机的经济和社会福利，这将威胁到网约车平台在东南亚最大市场的盈利能力。【原文：Millions of Indonesian ride-hailing drivers would receive major increases to financial and social benefits under a draft decree being considered by President Prabowo Subianto, two sources said, threatening the profitability of ride-sharing platforms in their largest market in Southeast Asia.】

item.title: 独家：消息人士称中国海关告知英伟达H200芯片不得入境
item.description: 据知情人士透露，中国海关本周告知报关行，英伟达H200人工智能芯片不得进入中国。【原文：Chinese customs authorities told customs agents this week that Nvidia's H200 artificial intelligence chips are not permitted to enter China, according to three people briefed on the matter.】

item.title: 萨克斯全球建筑师理查德·贝克告别斑驳的遗产
item.description: 贝克在零售与房地产投资的交叉领域拥有漫长的职业生涯，期间既有早期取得的重大成功，也有近年遭遇的惨痛失败。【原文：Baker has had a long ​career at the intersection of retail and real estate investment, including some big early wins and, more recently, some crushing losses.】

item.title: 独家：消息人士称巴基斯坦将与世界自由金融合作推出美元挂钩稳定币
item.description: 据周三知情人士透露，巴基斯坦已与一家与世界自由金融公司（World Liberty Financial）有关联的企业签署协议，该企业是美国总统唐纳德·特朗普家族旗下主要加密货币业务。双方将共同探索使用世界自由金融公司的稳定币进行跨境支付。【原文：Pakistan has ‌signed an agreement with a firm connected to World Liberty Financial, the main crypto business of the family of U.S. President Donald Trump, to explore using World Liberty’s stablecoin for cross-border payments, a source involved with the deal ​said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 萨克斯全球申请破产，美国零售业近年最大规模倒闭潮来袭
item.description: 萨克斯百货公司于周二深夜申请破产保护，成为过去十年间美国众多知名零售商倒闭名单上的又一例。这些企业因面临大型连锁店和在线零售商的激烈竞争而举步维艰，最终难以为继。【原文：Saks Global filed for bankruptcy late on Tuesday, adding to a long list of high-profile retail collapses in the United States in the past decade as they struggled to stay alive amid cut-throat competition from big-box and online retailers.】

item.title: 中国2025年对加贸易骤降，提醒访加的卡尼关注经济利害关系
item.description: 中国数据显示，去年中国从加拿大进口的商品数量出现2020年以来首次下滑。该数据在加拿大总理访华前数小时公布，鲜明地提醒着北京对渥太华的经济影响力。【原文：China bought fewer goods from Canada last year for the first time since 2020, according to Chinese data released hours before a visit by the Canadian prime minister, in a stark reminder of the economic leverage Beijing has over Ottawa.】

item.title: 早盘竞价：涡轮增压版"高桥贸易"令市场紧盯日元动向
item.description: 安库尔·班纳吉带您展望欧洲及全球市场今日走势【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Ankur Banerjee】

item.title: 《金融时报》报道：可口可乐放弃出售Costa Coffee计划
item.description: 《金融时报》周三报道称，由于私募股权公司的报价低于预期，可口可乐公司已放弃出售其Costa咖啡连锁店的计划。【原文：Coca-Cola has abandoned plans to sell its Costa Coffee chain after offers from private equity firms came in below expectations, the Financial Times reported on Wednesday.】

item.title: 萨克斯全球公司申请破产，此前尼曼·马库斯收购导致其财务崩溃
item.description: 高端百货集团萨克斯全球公司于周二深夜申请破产保护，这是疫情以来规模最大的零售业崩盘事件之一。【原文：High-end department store conglomerate Saks Global filed for bankruptcy protection late on Tuesday in one of the ​largest retail collapses since the pandemic.】

item.title: 新西兰央行行长因支持美联储政策引发强烈反弹
item.description: 新西兰外交部长温斯顿·彼得斯周三公开斥责该国新任央行行长，因其与其他全球央行行长联名签署声明支持美联储主席杰罗姆·鲍威尔。【原文：New Zealand's Foreign Minister Winston Peters on Wednesday publicly rebuked the country's new central bank governor for signing a statement alongside other global central bank chiefs in support of Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell.】

item.title: 台湾当局要求逮捕中国智能手机制造商一加公司首席执行官，指控其非法雇佣员工
item.description: 台湾检方周二对华硕旗下智能手机品牌一加的首席执行官签发逮捕令，指控其涉嫌在台湾从事非法商业及招募活动。【原文：Taiwan prosecutors on Tuesday issued an arrest warrant for the chief executive officer of Chinese smartphone maker OnePlus, alleging he was involved in illegal business and recruitment activities in Taiwan.】

item.title: 尽管存在出口限制，2025年中国稀土出口量仍创下至少2014年以来的最高纪录
item.description: 2025年中国稀土出口量达到至少2014年以来的最高水平，尽管北京自4月起开始限制多种中重稀土元素的出口。【原文：China's rare earth exports in 2025 hit the highest level since at least 2014, even as Beijing began restricting shipments of several medium to heavy elements from April.】

item.title: 中国经销商呼吁汽车品牌平衡库存水平以缓解供过于求局面
item.description: 中国汽车经销商协会表示，部分中国汽车品牌仍在向经销商推销过剩库存，并敦促其纠正这种做法以改善行业健康状况。【原文：Some Chinese auto brands are continuing to push excess inventories to dealers, the country's car dealers' association said, urging them to correct the practice to improve the industry's health.】

item.title: 尽管面临特朗普关税，中国2025年贸易顺差仍创下万亿美元纪录
item.description: 中国周三公布2025年出口强劲增长，贸易顺差创下万亿美元纪录。与此同时，生产商正为特朗普政府未来三年继续放缓中国生产引擎的政策做准备——该政策旨在将美国订单转移至其他市场。【原文：China on ​Wednesday reported a strong export run in 2025 with a record trillion-dollar surplus, as producers braced for three more years of a Trump ‌administration set on slowing the production powerhouse by shifting U.S. orders to other markets.】

item.title: 福特首席执行官称与墨西哥和加拿大的贸易协议对行业"至关重要"
item.description: 福特首席执行官吉姆·法利表示，北美自由贸易协定对这家汽车制造商和整个行业都至关重要。此前数小时，美国总统特朗普称该协定"无关紧要"。【原文：Ford CEO Jim Farley said a North American free trade deal is needed for the automaker and industry, hours after U.S. President Trump called it "irrelevant."】

item.title: 特斯拉同意接受调解，或可解决美国机构的种族歧视诉讼
item.description: 特斯拉同意接受调解，以解决美国平等就业机会委员会的诉讼。该诉讼指控埃隆·马斯克的电动汽车制造商纵容其位于加州弗里蒙特的组装工厂对黑人员工实施严重且普遍的骚扰行为。【原文：Tesla agreed to enter mediation that could resolve the U.S. Equal Employment Opportunity Commission's lawsuit accusing Elon Musk's electric car maker of tolerating severe and widespread harassment of Black employees at its Fremont, California, assembly plant.】

item.title: 研究机构称，全球电动汽车销量在经历2025年20%的强劲增长后，增速可能放缓
item.description: 数据显示，去年全球电动汽车注册量增长20%，但2026年增速可能放缓。由于中国市场增速放缓以及全球电动化目标的放宽，去年12月销量增幅创2024年2月以来最低水平。【原文：Global EV registrations grew 20% last year but are likely to lose pace in 2026, data showed on Wednesday, as a slowdown in China and a relaxation of electrification targets worldwide led in December to the smallest sales increase since February 2024.】

item.title: 亚洲股市小幅走高，日元疲软引发干预担忧
item.description: 亚洲股市周三上涨，受日本股市提振，投资者正为日本可能举行提前大选做准备，该选举或将带来更多财政刺激措施。与此同时，对央行独立性的担忧以及温和的美国通胀数据导致货币市场剧烈波动。【原文：Asian stocks rose on Wednesday, buoyed by Japanese shares, as investors braced for a snap election in Japan ​that could lead to more fiscal stimulus, while worries about central bank independence and benign U.S. inflation data whipsawed currencies.】

item.title: 芯片制造商恩智浦与中方控股方永达科技在荷兰法庭争夺控制权
item.description: 荷兰芯片制造商恩智浦的欧洲管理层将于周三在阿姆斯特丹法庭与公司中国母公司旺达科技对簿公堂，这场争夺控制权的最新交锋已导致汽车制造商使用的芯片短缺。【原文：Dutch chipmaker Nexperia's European managers face the company's Chinese owner Wingtech in an Amsterdam court on Wednesday in the latest round of a fight for control that has led to a shortage of chips used by carmakers.】

item.title: 油价涨势暂歇，委内瑞拉恢复石油运输，但伊朗问题阴云笼罩
item.description: 周三油价涨势暂歇，在连续四日攀升后出现回落，因委内瑞拉恢复出口。但中东主要产油国伊朗爆发致命骚乱后，市场仍笼罩在对伊朗供应中断的担忧之中。【原文：Oil prices paused their run of gains on Wednesday, slipping ​after four days of increases, as Venezuela resumed exports, but fears of Iranian supply disruptions following ‌deadly civil unrest in the major Middle Eastern producer loom over the market.】

item.title: "你死了吗？"中国单身生活应用爆红
item.description: 一款名为"你死了吗"的应用程序在中国引发热议，该应用专为独居人群设计，下载量激增且在社交媒体上引发广泛讨论，促使开发公司推出订阅收费模式，并为面向全球用户更改了名称。【原文：An app called "Are you dead" targeted at people living alone has gone viral in China, with surging downloads and widespread commentary on social media, prompting the company to introduce a subscription fee and change its name for a global audience.】

item.title: 特朗普表示他认为中国可以向美国商品开放市场
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德·特朗普周二表示，他认为中国能够向美国商品开放市场，并再次强调自己与中国国家主席习近平保持着良好关系。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump said on Tuesday he thinks China can open its markets to American goods, once again asserting he had a good relationship with Chinese leader Xi Jinping.】

item.title: 美元随符合预期的CPI数据反弹，银行家支持鲍威尔
item.description: 周三亚洲早盘时段，美元汇率回升至近一个月高位。此前公布的美国消费者物价指数（CPI）数据基本符合预期，强化了市场对美联储本月将维持利率不变的预期——尽管白宫施加了前所未有的降息压力。 衡量美元兑六种货币汇率的美元指数最新上涨0.3%至99.18，收复了周一的跌幅。此前美国总统特朗普威胁要对美联储主席杰罗姆·鲍威尔提起刑事指控。周二，全球央行行长和华尔街顶级银行首席执行官们纷纷表态支持鲍威尔。 澳新银行伦敦G3经济部主管布莱恩·马丁表示："政界人士、前美联储主席及其他官员正形成强烈共识，认为美联储独立性神圣不可侵犯，不容干预。"他在播客中指出："干预可能引发通胀上升、政府融资成本攀升及经济活动波动加剧等负面后果。" "市场正采取谨慎态度：他们不会草率下结论，我认为这种审慎会占上风，美联储的独立性将得到保护。"周二数据显示，12月美国消费者价格环比上涨0.3%，主要受租金和食品成本上升推动——此前因政府停摆导致的通胀人为压低效应已逐渐消退。 该数据强化了市场对美联储本月维持利率不变的预期。芝商所集团FedWatch工具显示，联邦基金期货当前隐含美联储在1月28日结束的下次为期两天的会议上按兵不动的概率为95.6%，较前日持平。 资本经济研究所分析师指出："只要美国通胀保持可控，对美联储独立性的间接攻击不太可能引发金融市场动荡。"在最高法院可能就特朗普紧急关税合法性作出裁决前，亚洲早盘多数货币对波动性保持温和。荷兰国际集团分析师在研究报告中表示："裁决可能认定关税合法，若如此我们便继续前行。 "我们预计裁决将予以否决，但市场仍可能无动于衷。"荷兰国际集团分析师在研究报告中表示。 "当前美国国债市场展现出非凡的'漠不关心'能力。"美元兑日元最新报159.025日元基本持平，此前路透日银短观调查显示日本制造业信心指数1月跌至六个月低点（但仍处于正值区间）。 此前因市场猜测日本首相高市早苗可能提前举行国会选举以巩固权力，日元一度跌至2024年1月以来最低水平。读卖新闻周三报道称，她正考虑于2月8日举行众议院提前选举。 离岸人民币兑美元汇率报6.9708元，持平于前一交易日。中国12月贸易数据将于数小时后公布。澳元兑美元上涨0.1%至0.6688美元，纽元兑美元小幅攀升0.1%至0.5740美元。 欧元兑美元汇率持平于1.1642美元，英镑兑美元汇率同样维持在1.3423美元不变。比特币上涨1.8%至95,751.99美元，创下两个月来最高水平；以太币最新上涨4.0%至3,334.46美元。【原文：The U.S. dollar recovered ground to near a one-month high in early Asian trade ​on Wednesday after U.S. CPI data that was broadly in line with estimates, firming up expectations that the Federal Reserve ‌will remain on hold later this month despite unprecedented pressure from the White House to lower interest rates. The U.S. dollar index , which measures the greenback's strength against a basket of six currencies, was last up 0.3% at 99.18, retracing losses from Monday after U.S. President Donald Trump threatened Fed Chair Jerome Powell with a criminal indictment. Global central bank chiefs and top Wall Street bank CEOs lined up in support of Powell on Tuesday. "There's a very loud chorus of opinion ‌coming from politicians, former Fed chairmen and other officials that Fed independence is sacrosanct and cannot be interfered with," ​said Brian Martin, head of G3 Economics at ANZ in London. "It risks having adverse consequences of higher inflation, higher funding costs for the government and more volatility in economic activity," he said on a podcast. "Markets are erring on the side of caution: They're not jumping to conclusions, and ‍I think that sense will prevail and that the independence of the Fed will be protected." On Tuesday, data showed U.S. consumer prices increased 0.3% in December compared to the previous month, lifted by higher costs for rents and food as some of the distortions related to the government shutdown that had artificially lowered inflation in November unwound. ⁠The print cemented expectations the Federal Reserve would leave interest rates unchanged this month, with Fed funds futures currently pricing an implied 95.6% probability ‍that the U.S. central bank will remain on hold when its next two-day meeting concludes on 28 January, unchanged from a day earlier, according to the CME ‌Group's FedWatch ‌tool. "Indirect attacks on the Fed’s independence aren’t likely to roil the financial markets in the U.S., so long as inflation there remains under control," wrote analysts from Capital Economics. Volatility in most currency pairs was subdued in early Asian trading ahead of a possible Supreme Court ruling on the legality of Trump's emergency tariffs. "It could rule them legit, and if so we just move on. We suspect they will be struck down, and we'll ⁠probably still just move on," analysts ⁠from ING wrote in a ​research report. "This Treasury market is showing a remarkable capacity to just not care too much about stuff." Against the yen , the U.S. dollar was last flat at 159.025 yen, little changed after the Reuters Tankan poll showed Japanese manufacturers' confidence slipped to a six-month low in January, albeit still in positive territory. The yen had earlier ‍fallen to its weakest levels since January 2024 on speculation that Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi may call parliamentary elections to consolidate her power. The Yomiuri newspaper reported on Wednesday that she is considering snap lower house elections on February 8. Against the Chinese yuan trading offshore in Hong Kong , the U.S. dollar was last flat at 6.9708 yuan ​ahead of the release of Chinese trade data for December in a few hours' time. The ‍Australian dollar was last up 0.1% at $0.6688, while the New Zealand dollar nudged 0.1% upwards to $0.5740. The euro was last flat at $1.1642, while the British pound also held steady at $1.3423. Bitcoin gained ​1.8% to $95,751.99, rising to the highest level in two months, while ether was last up 4.0% at $3,334.46.】
